{"step_by_step_thinking": "The auriculotemporal nerve is a branch of the mandibular division of the trigeminal nerve (V3). It provides sensory innervation to the skin of the temple, external ear, and part of the scalp. The nerve courses anteriorly and superiorly, and it wraps around the superficial temporal artery, which is a branch of the external carotid artery. Therefore, the correct answer is A. Superficial temporal artery.", "answer_choice": "A"}
